author: Peter Carbonetto

In the *Bayesian data analysis* book (3rd ed), the authors make the
following claim: *Setting ${\bf\Sigma} \sim
\mbox{Inv-Wishart}_{d+1}({\bf I})$ has the appealing feature that each
of the correlations in Î£ has, marginally, a uniform prior
distribution.*
[Note: ${\bf\Sigma}$ and ${\bf I}$ are $d \times d$ matrices.] Here I
check this claim in some small simulations.

```{r knitr-opts, include=FALSE}

                      fig.align = "center",dpi = 120)
```
